revision.text:
{{Infobox wrestling promotion |name = Hart Legacy Wrestling |image = File:Hart Legacy Wrestling.png |acronym = HLW |established = 2013 |folded = |style = Canadian Wrestling |location = [[Calgary]], [[Alberta]], Canada |founder = |owner = Matt Hart (2015–today)
Smith Hart (2015–2017)
John Oniston (2013){{cite web|title= Lance Storm Talks Problems With Hart Legacy Wrestling Event And Outstanding Payment Issues|publisher= wrestlinginc.com|url=http://www.wrestlinginc.com/wi/news/2013/0218/560469/lance-storm-talks-problems-with-hart-legacy-wrestling-event-and/}} |parent = Universal Ultimate Games inc |sister = |formerly = |website = }} '''Hart Legacy Wrestling (HLW)'''{{cite web|title= Hart Legacy Wrestling (HLW)|publisher=cagematch.net|url= http://www.cagematch.net/?id=8&nr=1017 }} is a [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[professional wrestling promotion]] operated by some members of the [[Hart wrestling family]], it was founded mainly by [[Teddy Hart]] and his associates.{{cite web|url=http://www.hartlegacywrestling.com|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling|accessdate=January 17, 2016|publisher=Hart Legacy Wrestling}} [[Smith Hart]] was also involved with the promotion prior to his death on July 2, 2017,{{cite web |author =Oliver, Greg |url= http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2017/06/02/22728339.html |title=Smith Hart passes away |work=SLAM! Wrestling |publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer|Canoe.com]]|accessdate=2017-07-12}} his son [[Matt Hart (wrestler)|Matt Hart]] is the current owner of the promotion.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cagematch.net/?id=8&nr=1017|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling (HLW) « Promotions Database « CAGEMATCH - The Internet Wrestling Database|last=Kreikenbohm|first=Philip|website=www.cagematch.net|access-date=2018-01-22}} [[Bret Hart]] has no involvement in HLW.{{cite web|title=The Hart family will be involved with a new promotion called Hart Family Legacy |publisher= onlineworldofwrestling.com|url= http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/55297/the-hart-family-will-be-involved-with-a-new-promotion-called-hart-family-legacy/}}{{cite web|title= HART FAMILY LAUNCHES NEW PROMOTION, LIVE IN THE OLD HART HOUSE AND MORE NEWS|publisher=PWInsider|url= http://www.pwinsider.com/article/74565/hart-family-launches-new-promotion-live-in-the-old-hart-house-and-more-news.html?p=1}}{{cite web|url=https://www.pwinsider.com/ViewArticle.php?id=75187|title=HART LEGACY WRESTLING LOOKS TO BE DONE ALREADY - PWInsider.com|website=www.pwinsider.com}} ==History== ===Shows=== The promotion was announced in 2012, founded and had their first show in the [[Victoria Arena (Calgary)|Victoria Pavilion]] in 2013.{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T6WdQfUtnFc|title=Global Toronto - Hart Legacy Wrestling|date=14 December 2012|publisher=|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=http://www.calgarysun.com/2012/12/11/wrestling-returns-to-victoria-pavilion-with-hart-legacy-wrestlings-resurrection |title=Wrestling returns to Victoria Pavilion with Hart Legacy Wrestling's Resurrection|author=McMurray, Jenna|publisher=[[Calgary Sun]]|date= December 11, 2012|accessdate=2016-01-30}}{{cite web|title=HART LEGACY WRESTLING PRESENTS "RESURRECTION!"|author=Apter, Bill|date=December 10, 2012|publisher=[[1Wrestling.com]]|url=http://www.1wrestling.com/2012/12/10/hart-legacy-wrestling-presents-resurrection/}} In 2013 HLW held a show at the Stampede Pavilion named "Resurrection".{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gDzzfDWCesQ|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling - Resurrection|date=6 December 2012|publisher=|via=YouTube}} The event starred wrestlers such as, [[Konnan]], [[Chris Masters]], [[Bobby Lashley]], [[Trent Barreta]], [[Samuray del Sol]], The Super Smash Brothers, [[Cody Hall]] as well as [[IWGP Tag Team Champions]] [[Davey Boy Smith Jr.|Davey Boy Smith Jr. (David Hart Smith)]] and [[Lance Archer]]. The event had the final Canadian independent appearance of [[El Generico]] before his signing with [[WWE]].{{cite web |url= http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2013/01/15/20499731.html|title= Wrestling "Resurrected" Friday at Stampede Pavilion: Hart Legacy Wrestling debuts at Calgary's legendary venue |date=April 21, 2015 |publisher=[[canoe.ca|Canadian Online Explorer]]}} It also featured a 12-man battle royale consisting mostly of local talent.{{cite web|url= http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2013/01/19/pf-20509161.html|title=Action speaks loudly at Hart Legacy Wrestling|author=Jason, Clevett|work=Slam! Wrestling|publisher=[[Canoe.ca|Canadian Online Explorer]]|date= January 19, 2013|accessdate=2016-01-31}}{{cite web|url=http://411mania.com/wrestling/hart-legacy-wrestling-promote-first-show-of-2013/|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling Promote First Show of 2013|author=Thomas, Jeremy|work=Wrestling/NEWS|publisher=411mania.com|date= April 21, 2015|accessdate=2016-05-03}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.wewantinsanity.com/am2/publish/AaronWood/TGIF_12513_printer.shtml|title=TGIF: Rock Gets Shielded, WWE 2k14, and More|website=www.wewantinsanity.com|access-date=2018-01-22}} Kevin Nash had to pull out of the event after his wife became ill.http://www.allwrestlingnews.com/2013/01/18/clayton-jack-heel-wwe-wwe-superstar-returns-injury-kevin-nash/ During the event wrestler [[Pete Wilson (wrestler)|Pete Wilson]] suffered a shoulder injury and was rushed to the [[emergency room|ER]].{{cite web|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling Issues Already |publisher= PWInsider |url= http://pwinsider.com/article/74969/hart-legacy-wrestling-issues-already.html?p=1}} Harry Smith and Teddy Hart would have a rematch in 2014, after that Smith returned after performing in Japan.{{Cite news|url=http://www.pwmania.com/drake-younger-works-wwe-nxt-tv-tapings-shields-top-10-six-man-matches-vampiro-more|title=Drake Younger Works WWE NXT TV Tapings, Shield's Top 10 Six-Man Matches, Vampiro, More {{!}} PWMania|work=PWMania|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}} In September 2015 an event was held which featured a match for the NWA World Women's Title between [[Santana Garrett]] and Shojo Machiko which Garrett won. It also featured two matches with Teddy Hart.{{cite web|url= http://www.cagematch.net/?id=1&nr=137075|title=HLW Event Data|publisher=cagematch.net|date= September 9, 2015|accessdate=2016-03-04}} In December 2015 the promotion held a Hopes & Ropes charity event at the Ranchmans Roadhouse in Calgary.{{cite web|title= "Hopes & Ropes" Calgary Fundraiser Announced|publisher=1wrestling.com|url=http://www.1wrestling.com/2015/12/01/hopes-ropes-calgary-fundraiser-announced/}}{{cite web|title= Hart family wrestlers to take to the ring in Hopes & Ropes charity match|publisher= [[Calgary Herald]]|url=http://calgaryherald.com/news/local-news/hart-family-wrestlers-to-take-to-the-ring-in-hopes-ropes-charity-match}} [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uPXG72xMv5Y Video]{{cite web|title= DAILY UPDATE: WWE TLC FALLOUT, STRONG CROWD EXPECTED FOR RAW|first=Dave|last=Meltzer|authorlink=Dave Meltzer|website=f4wonline.com|publisher= [[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]|url= http://www.f4wonline.com/daily-updates/daily-update-wwe-tlc-fallout-strong-crowd-expected-raw-203736}}{{cite web|title= Hart Legacy Wrestling: Hopes N Ropes|publisher= cagematch.net|url= http://www.cagematch.net/?id=1&nr=142135}}{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FNdCYwGUOk4|title=HART LEGACY: WRESTLING NEWS - (HOPES & ROPES) CALGARY YOUTH FUNDRAISER DEC 13 2015|date=3 December 2015|publisher=|via=YouTube}}{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abvnSPSZE4E|title=HART VS HART OFFICIAL PRESS CONFERENCE CALGARY ALBERTA HART LEGACY WRESTLING|date=6 December 2015|publisher=|via=YouTube}} The main event was a match between cousins Teddy Hart and David Hart Smith.{{cite web|url=http://calgaryherald.com/life/swerve/5-family-friendly-things-to-do-this-weekend-in-calgary-32 |title=5 family-friendly things to do this weekend in Calgary|author=Weir, Bruce|publisher=[[Calgary Herald]]|date= December 9, 2015|accessdate=2016-01-30}} The event was put on together with the Aboriginal Friendship Centre of Calgary, the main event between Smith and Hart was for the Stu Hart Heavyweight Championship Belt. The event's goal was to raise money for anti-bullying and self-confidence programs for children.{{cite web|url=http://www.ottawacitizen.com/Hart+family+wrestlers+take+ring+Hopes+Ropes+charity+match/11569016/story.html|title=Hart family wrestlers to take to the ring in Hopes & Ropes charity match|author=Rhodes, Ted|publisher=[[Ottawa Citizen]]|date=Dec 4, 2015|accessdate=2016-01-31|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422054622/http://www.ottawacitizen.com/Hart+family+wrestlers+take+ring+Hopes+Ropes+charity+match/11569016/story.html#|archive-date=2016-04-22|dead-url=yes|df=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.edmontonjournal.com/Hart+family+wrestlers+take+ring+Hopes+Ropes+charity+match/11569016/story.html|title=Wrestlers from Calgary’s Hart family and Dungeon Discipline wrestling school are scheduled to take to the ring on Dec. 13 for the Hopes & Ropes charity match, put on by Hart Legacy|publisher=[[Edmonton Journal]]|date=Dec 5, 2015|accessdate=2016-01-31}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{Citation |url=http://www.sportintense.com/posts/hart-legacy-wrestling-news-hopes-ropes-calgary-youth-fundraiser-dec-13-2015/|author=Brian, George |title= HART LEGACY: WRESTLING NEWS – (HOPES & ROPES) CALGARY YOUTH FUNDRAISER DEC 13 2015 |website= sportintense.com|publisher= Intense Sports |date=December 3, 2015|accessdate=2016-05-02}} In February 2016 it was announced that the next event would be held on March 6, 2016 and that the main event would once again be Teddy Hart vs David Hart Smith.{{cite news| url= http://www.pw-core.com/videos/Hart_Legacy_Wrestling_Hart_vs_Hart_2_Unfinished_Business_Feb_6_2016_Event_Wrestling_Promo_Video/83442| title=Hart Legacy Wrestling: Hart vs. Hart 2 - Unfinished Business Feb 6 2016 Event|date=2016-02-05}} The event was again held at the Ranchmans Roadhouse.{{cite news|url=http://healthplanets.com/bret-hart-surgery-is-a-huge-success-smith-hart-health-update-hart-legacy-wrestling-news/|title=BRET HART SURGERY IS A HUGE SUCCESS! SMITH HART HEALTH UPDATE & HART LEGACY WRESTLING NEWS|publisher=healthplanets.com|date=2016-03-04}}{{dead link|date=October 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|url=http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/137728/upcoming-indy-wrestling-events-march-2-13-2016/|title=Upcoming Indy wrestling events March 2-13, 2016|publisher=Online World Of Wrestling|accessdate=2016-03-04}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/04/17/sundayapril17events/|title=Sunday Events Center - Gunner at PWX in Charlotte, Callihan & Ciampa at AWE in Atlanta, Abyss & Haas at Circle City, Gargano & Lio Rush at Next Gen, Ray Rowe in Austin, Hart Legacy, SPW -|date=2016-04-17|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://archive.is/JQjgb|title=HART LEGACY WRESTLING / UNFINISHED BUSINESS II at Ranchman's Cookhous…|date=2018-01-11|work=archive.is|access-date=2018-01-22}} In July 2016 the company held an event called the Stu Hart Memorial Cup.{{Cite web|url=http://www.wherevent.com/detail/Hart-Legacy-STU-HART-MEMORIAL-CUP|title=STU HART MEMORIAL CUP|website=www.wherevent.com|language=en|access-date=2018-01-22}} ===Controversies=== ====Payment==== The 2013 show, "Resurrection", was followed by many wrestlers claiming that the promotion failed to pay them. A hotel manager in the area has also stated that a large amount of rooms were booked but that the bills were never paid by the promotion. [[Teddy Hart]] has claimed that the responsibility lays with the owners and promoters, John Oniston and Stacey "Angel" Olszak, others have maintained that Teddy was the one who was said to be in charge.{{cite web|title=Statement: Talent Not Paid by Hart Legacy Wrestling |publisher= wrestleview.com|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/roh-indy-wrestling-news/39323-statement-talent-not-paid-by-hart-legacy-wrestling}}{{cite web|title= Complaints grow over Hart family wrestling event|publisher= [[CBC.ca]]|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/complaints-grow-over-hart-family-wrestling-event-1.1311076}} Hart continued to state that he simply lent his name to the event and featured as a wrestler and did not handle any of the other aspect of the promotion.{{Cite news|url=http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/possible-trouble-for-the-new-hart-legacy-wrestling-promotion/|title=Possible trouble for the new Hart Legacy Wrestling promotion?|work=Online World of Wrestling|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.ewrestlingnews.com/news/hart-legacy-wrestling-cancels-show-details|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling Cancels Show - Details - eWrestlingNews.com|date=2013-02-04|work=eWrestlingNews.com|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}} Wrestler [[Lance Storm]]{{Cite news|url=http://www.pwmania.com/lance-storm-talks-problems-hart-legacy-wrestling-event-outstanding-payment-issues|title=Lance Storm Talks Problems With Hart Legacy Wrestling Event & Outstanding Payment Issues {{!}} PWMania|work=PWMania|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}} and Jeff Jackson, who served as play by play commentator for the event, have stated that John Oniston who was the promoter for the event had talked to everyone backstage after the show had concluded and ensured them that they would be paid eventually and that they would receive a bonus of 100 [[Canadian dollar|C$]].{{cite web|title= Former WWE & WCW Superstar Comments On Financial Issues With Hart Legacy Wrestling, Former HLW Executive Provides a Rebuttal To Storm's Comments|publisher= prowrestlingmadness.weebly.com|url= http://prowrestlingmadness.weebly.com/latest-news/former-wwe-wcw-superstar-comments-on-finanical-issues-with-hart-legacy-wrestling-former-hlw-executives-provide-rebuttals-to-storms-comments}}{{dead link|date=October 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|title= Interview – Lance Storm on Hart Legacy Wrestling|publisher= [[Fight Network]]|url=http://fightnetwork.com/news/6384651:interview-lance-storm-on-hart-legacy-wrestling-full/}}{{cite web|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling promotion screws talent and staff over pay |publisher= oklafan.com|url=http://www.oklafan.com/v4/news/6141/article.html}} In late 2013 Jackson told to [[CBC Radio]] once again mentioned that Aniston had said to him and the other workers from the event that they would be given their money later on and that they would be compensated for their troubles. He added that Teddy Hart, David Hart Smith and [[Wayne Hart (wrestling)|Wayne Hart]] were the only Hart family members to be involved in the promotion at the time of the event. He also stated that while he had at the time still not been paid, he said that he did not expect for his payment to ever come. Jackson claimed that the pavilion which the event was held at had at least between 1200 and 1800 people in it and that the cheapest tickets were for 25 C$, so there should not have been any problem to pay everyone. Jackson claimed that HLW originally planned another event on February 22 that was supposed to feature former WWE wrestler [[John Morrison (wrestler)|John Morrison]] but the event was canceled due to issues.{{cite web|title= CBC Radio talks to Jeff Jackson about Hart Legacy Wrestling|publisher= [[CBC Radio]] |url=https://archive.org/details/CbcRadioTalksToJeffJacksonAboutHartLegacyWrestling}} The February show was replaced by a new promotion handled by the same people and the professional wrestling newsletter ''[[Figure Four Online]]'' made the following statement:{{cite web|url= http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2013/02/07/20560101.html|title=Another big Calgary promotion to debut|author=Oliver, Greg|work=Slam! Wrestling|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|date= April 21, 2015|accessdate=2016-01-31}} : "The Hart Legacy Wrestling promotion in Calgary with all the issues regarding payment to wrestlers has shut down, but essentially the same group, without John Oniston, is running a new promotion called AAA Canada Next Generation Wrestling on 2/22 at the Victoria Pavilion in Calgary with John Morrison, Kevin Nash, Davey Boy Smith Jr., Konnan, Teddy Hart, Jack Evans and Necro Butcher. A press conference was scheduled for Calgary today and they claim that all talent has already been paid in advance. They plan to run an iPPV that will be taped for the next day. [[B.J. Annis]] (the father of Teddy Hart) is behind the new company and Spencer Tapley is the front person for talent and media. Tapley wrote a letter to talent, blaming Oniston for being deceitful and said the only reason they were over budget is because others in charge bought airline tickets at the last minute."''Wrestling Observer Newsletter'', 2013{{Cite news|url=https://www.ewrestlingnews.com/news/aaa-canada-set-to-replace-hart-legacy-wrestling|title=AAA Canada Set To Replace Hart Legacy Wrestling - eWrestlingNews.com|date=2013-02-07|work=eWrestlingNews.com|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.pwinsider.com/article/75265/new-calgary-promotion-headed-by-teddy-hart-to-replace-hart-legacy-wrestling.html|title=NEW CALGARY PROMOTION HEADED BY TEDDY HART TO REPLACE HART LEGACY WRESTLING {{!}} PWInsider.com|website=www.pwinsider.com|access-date=2018-01-22}} The issue was settled by 2015.{{Cite news|archive-date=2018-02-23|archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6xReSbPZE?url=https://www.f4wonline.com/daily-updates/daily-update-wwe-tlc-fallout-strong-crowd-expected-raw-203736#|url=https://www.f4wonline.com/daily-updates/daily-update-wwe-tlc-fallout-strong-crowd-expected-raw-203736|title=Daily Update: WWE TLC Fallout, strong crowd expected for RAW|author=Meltzer, Dave|date=December 14, 2015|work=WON/F4W - WWE news, Pro Wrestling News, WWE Results, UFC News, UFC results|access-date=2018-01-22|dead-url=no|df=}} ====David Benoit==== In April 2014 [[Smith Hart]] announced that David Benoit, the son of controversial wrestler [[Chris Benoit]] was to make his in ring debut for Hart Legacy Wrestling on July 18 in Calgary in a tag team match with [[Chavo Guerrero]], a friend of his father Chris.{{Cite web|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/Other_News_4/article_78087.shtml#.WlFP6WjibIU|title=PWTorch.com - BENOIT NEWS: David Benoit to make wrestling debut in July|website=www.pwtorch.com|access-date=2018-01-22}}{{cite web|title=David Benoit, son of Chris Benoit, to make wrestling debut for Hart Legacy Wrestling on July 18th |publisher= kocosports.net|url= http://kocosports.net/2014/04/29/wrestling/david-benoit-son-of-chris-benoit-to-make-wrestling-debut-for-hart-legacy-wrestling-on-july-18th/}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.pwinsider.com/article/85442/pitbulls-scorpio-to-be-inducted-into-ecw-arena-hardcore-hall-hardy-wins-mcw-title-low-ki-vs-daniels-bolivia-hero-in-france-and-more-news-.html|title=PITBULLS & SCORPIO TO BE INDUCTED INTO ECW ARENA HARDCORE HALL, HARDY WINS MCW TITLE, LOW KI VS. DANIELS, BOLIVIA, HERO IN FRANCE AND MORE NEWS {{!}} PWInsider.com|website=www.pwinsider.com|access-date=2018-01-22}} Hart claimed that Benoit had been trained by his nephew [[David Hart Smith]].{{cite web|title=Chris Benoit’s Son Making His Pro Wrestling Debut In Tag Match With Former WWE Star |publisher= pwmania.com |url= http://www.pwmania.com/chris-benoits-son-making-his-pro-wrestling-debut-in-tag-match-with-former-wwe-star}} The match was later canceled{{Cite news|url=https://issuu.com/dailynwatch/docs/saturday_17-05-2014_e_version|title=Saturday 17 05 2014 e version|work=Issuu|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en}} in May when another friend of David's father, [[Chris Jericho]] informed Guerrero that David did not have any formal training, prompting Guerrero to pull out of the match. Hart had told different versions to the two men, to Guerrero he had said that David had received training for the match but had also told Jericho that David would not be wrestling, just involved in a storyline.{{cite web|title=David Benoit’s Pro Wrestling Debut Cancelled Amid Controversy; Chavo Guerrero Pulls Out of Event & Chris Jericho "Furious"|publisher= wrestlezone.com|url= http://www.wrestlezone.com/news/475359-david-benoits-pro-wrestling-debut-cancelled-chavo-guerrero-pulls-out-of-event-chris-jericho-furious}}{{cite web|title=Update: The Latest on the David Benoit Smith Hart Situation, How Jericho Got Involved, Why Chavo Backed Out of the Match & Much More|publisher= wrestlezone.com|url= http://www.wrestlezone.com/news/475559-latest-on-david-benoit-smith-hart-situation}}{{cite web|title=David Benoit's pro wrestling debut cancelled under strange circumstances|publisher=cagesideseats.com |url=http://www.cagesideseats.com/indies-independent-wrestling-indy-promotions/2014/5/10/5705430/david-benoits-pro-wrestling-debut-cancelled-under-strange}}{{cite web|title=Smith Hart Comments On David Benoit’s In-Ring Wrestling Debut Being Canceled|publisher=sescoops.com |url=http://www.sescoops.com/smith-hart-comments-david-benoits-ring-wrestling-debut-canceled/}} Jericho insisted that David would not be included in the show due to his lack of training and was reportedly upset at the promotion for using David to advertise the show.{{cite web|title=WWE NEWS: CHRIS BENOIT’S SON ATTENDS WWE EVENT SATURDAY NIGHT IN EDMONTON|publisher=inquisitr.com |url=http://www.inquisitr.com/1806470/wwe-news-chris-benoits-son-attends-wwe-event-saturday-night-in-edmonton/}}{{Cite news|url=http://wrestlingnews.co/wwe-news/chris-benoits-son-to-make-his-wrestling-debut/|title=Chris Benoit's son to make his wrestling debut {{!}} Wrestling News|date=2014-04-29|work=Wrestling News|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.pwmania.com/smith-hart-comments-on-david-benoits-pro-wrestling-in-ring-debut-being-canceled|title=Smith Hart Comments On David Benoit's Pro Wrestling In-Ring Debut Being Canceled {{!}} PWMania|work=PWMania|access-date=2018-01-22|language=en-US}} ==Talent== ===Wrestlers=== {{div col|colwidth=22em}} *[[Teddy Hart]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=5|title=Teddy Hart poses at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=[[Canoe.ca]]}} *[[David Hart Smith]]{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i8Kep-jqF1w |title= HART VS HART TEDDY HART VS DAVEY BOY SMITH JR HART LEGACY WRESTLING ANDRE CORBEIL SHOW 12|date=18 December 2015|publisher=|via=YouTube}} *[[Pete Wilson (wrestler)|Pete Wilson]]{{cite web|title= 1/18 HART LEGACY WRESTLING RESULTS: CALGARY, ALBERTA |publisher=wrestleview.com |url= http://www.wrestleview.com/roh-indy-wrestling-news/39216-1-18-hart-legacy-wrestling-results-calgary-alberta}} *[[Matt Hart (wrestler)|Matt Hart]]{{cite web|title=Hart Legacy Wrestling to debut in Calgary on 1/16 |publisher= WrestleView|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/indy-news/38386-hart-legacy-wrestling-to-debut-in-calgary-on-1-16/|date=December 16, 2012|author=Martin, Adam}} *[[Trent Barreta]]{{cite book | authorlink = John Grasso | title = Historical Dictionary of Wrestling | publisher = Scarecrow Press, inc. | year = 2014 | location = | url = | doi = | id = | isbn = 978-0-8108-7926-3| page = 37 pp}} *[[Jack Evans (wrestler)|Jack Evans]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=0|title=AAA star Jack Evans returns to Calgary at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=[[Canoe.ca]]}} *[[Brian Cage]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=2|title=Trent Baretta mocks Brian Cage at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=Canoe.ca}} *[[Samuray Del Sol]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=4|title=Samuray Del Sol sends Flip Kendrick flying at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=Canoe.ca}} *[[El Generico]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=11|title=Samuray Del Sol and WWE bound El Generico at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=Canoe.ca}} *[[Chris Masters]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=12|title=Chris Masters makes an entrance at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=Canoe.ca}} *[[Lance Archer]]{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/Microgalleries/HartLegacyJan2013/?&pic=13|title=Lance Archer and Chris Masters duke it out ringside at the Hart Legacy Wrestling debut show|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=Canoe.ca}} *[[Bobby Lashley]]{{cite {{Infobox album | name = Immortal | type = [[Soundtrack]] | longtype = / [[Remix album]] | artist = [[Michael Jackson]] | cover = Michael_jackson_immortal_album_cover.jpg | alt = | released = {{start date|2011|11|18}} | recorded = 1969–1999 (original tracks)
2011 (additional mixes & overdubs) | venue = | studio = | genre = {{hlist|[[Contemporary R&B|R&B]]|[[Pop music|pop]]|[[Soul music|soul]]|[[Rock music|rock]]|[[Gospel music|gospel]]|[[Disco music|disco]]|[[new jack swing]]|[[funk]]|[[post-disco]]|[[adult contemporary]]}} | length = {{Duration|m=76|s=34}} (standard edition)
{{Duration|m=106|s=9}} (deluxe edition) | label = {{hlist|[[Epic Records|Epic]]|[[Sony Music Entertainment|Sony]]|MJJ Productions}} | producer = {{hlist|Michael Jackson|Kevin Antunes}} | prev_title = [[Michael (album)|Michael]] | prev_year = 2010 | next_title = [[Icon (Michael Jackson album)|Icon]] | next_year = 2012 | misc = {{Singles | name = Immortal | type = Soundtrack | single1 = [[Immortal Megamix]]: [[Can You Feel It (The Jacksons song)|Can You Feel It]]/[[Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough]]/[[Billie Jean]]/[[Black or White]] (Immortal Version) | single1date = November 1, 2011 }} }} '''''Immortal''''' is a [[remix album]] of music originally recorded by American recording artist [[Michael Jackson]], and featuring [[The Jackson 5|The Jackson 5/The Jacksons]], released on November 18, 2011 by [[Epic Records]]. The album is a [[soundtrack]] to [[Cirque du Soleil]]'s [[Michael Jackson: The Immortal World Tour]], which debuted on October 2, 2011 in [[Montreal]].{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/466976/michael-jacksons-immortal-wont-be-his-last-album-says-estate|title=Michael Jackson's 'Immortal' Won't Be His Last Album, Says Estate|date=2011-10-04|accessdate=2011-10-05|first=Marc|last=Schneider|publisher=Billboard.com}} ==Background and release== On October 3, 2011, [[Sony Music Entertainment]] announced that over 40 of Jackson's original recordings were redesigned and reimagined by the [[Justin Timberlake]] and [[Rihanna]] producer Kevin Antunes throughout a year-period work in the studio with original [[Multitrack recording|multi-track]] [[master recording]]s.{{cite web|title=IMMORTAL, the highly anticipated musical tapestry for Cirque du Soleil's Michael Jackson THE IMMORTAL World Tour|url=http://m.fans.sonymusicemail.com/nl/jsp/m.jsp?c=3176d0f1a67d41fce6|publisher=Sony Music Entertainment|accessdate=4 October 2011}} Hence it's expected that ''Immortal'' will continue a similar [[Audio mixing (recorded music)|mixing production]] to the soundtracks to previous Cirque du Soleil's shows: 2006's ''[[Love (The Beatles album)|Love]]'', with the remixed music of [[The Beatles]] (to [[Love (Cirque du Soleil)|the show of the same name]]), and 2010's [[Elvis Presley]]-themed remix soundtrack ''[[Viva Elvis (album)|Viva Elvis]]'' (to [[Viva Elvis|the show of the same name]]). Being released by [[Epic Records]] in conjunction with estate of Michael Jackson,{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/entertainment/2011/10/new-michael-jackson-album-immortal-to-be-released/|title=New Michael Jackson Album, 'Immortal', to Be Released|date=2011-10-03|accessdate=2011-10-06|publisher=abc.go.com|work=[[ABC News]]|first=Suzan|last=Clarke}} ''Immortal'' features an alternative version of The Jackson 5 song "[[ABC (song)|ABC]]", as well as a series of [[Mashup (music)|mashups]] and remixes such as a choir-assisted rendition of "[[They Don't Care About Us]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1671863/michael-jackson-immortal-album.jhtml|title=Michael Jackson Immortal Album Due November 21|date=2011-10-03|accessdate=2011-10-05|first=Gil|last=Kaufman|publisher=[[MTV.com]]}} Despite over 60 songs had been used for the stage show, the album release will be available as a 20-track album or a deluxe 27-track album only. ''Immortal'' is the eighth album to be released by Sony and Motown/Universal since Michael Jackson's death on June 25, 2009. It is also the third set of remixes of Jackson's music released [[List of works published posthumously|posthumously]], following two 2009 collections, ''[[The Stripped Mixes]]'', Jackson's early songs with most of [[rhythm section]] [[Audio mixing (recorded music)|edited out]], and four [[Extended play|EP]]s under the common title ''[[The Remix Suite]]''. ==Promotion== The debut track from this album entitled "[[Immortal Megamix]]", which was composed of four of Michael's greatest hits - "[[Can You Feel It (The Jacksons song)|Can You Feel It]]," "[[Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough]]," "[[Billie Jean]]," and "[[Black or White]]" had been unveiled on [[AOL.com|AolMusic]] on October 31, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsroomamerica.com/story/186957/michael_jackson_%22immortal_megamix%22_released.html|title=Michael Jackson "Immortal Megamix" Released|author=Peter Fowler|publisher=Newsroom America|date=2011-10-31|accessdate=2011-10-31}} Following the premiere on AOL, the track became available to stream at www.MichaelJackson.com{{cite web|url=http://www.michaeljackson.com/us/news/listen-immortal-megamix-now|title=Listen to the "Immortal Megamix" Now!|publisher=The Official Michael Jackson Site|work=SonyMusic|date=2011-10-31|accessdate=2011-10-31}} and on Jackson's Facebook page.{{cite web|url=http://www.v6.facebook.com/michaeljackson|title=Listen to "Immortal Megamix" – the debut track from the upcoming album IMMORTAL now and let us know what you think!|date=2011-10-31|accessdate=2011-10-31}} On November 1, 2011, the track became available as a digital download on [[iTunes]] and [[amazon.com]].{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Immortal-Megamix-Enough-Billie-Version/dp/B005ZN7W12|title=Amazon.com: Immortal Megamix: Can You Feel It/Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough/Billie Jean/Black Or White (''Immortal'' Version): The Jacksons;Michael Jackson: MP3 Downloads|publisher=[[amazon.com]]|accessdate=2011-10-30}} There was no television promotion or radio airplay. The week before its release, several tracks were unveiled on [[SoundCloud]] & [[Billboard.com]]: *"[[You Are Not Alone]]/[[I Just Can't Stop Loving You]] (Immortal Version)" on November 14, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://soundcloud.com/mjimmortal/youarenotalone|title=You Are Not Alone/I Just Can't Stop Loving You by MJImmortal on SoundCloud|publisher=[[SoundCloud]]|work=Sony Music|accessdate=2011-11-14|date=2011-11-14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.michaeljackson.com/us/node/1200249|title=Listen to a Brand New Track from IMMORTAL|date=2011-11-14|accessdate=2011-11-15|publisher=The Official Michael Jackson Site|work=Sony Music}} *"[[Wanna Be Startin' Somethin']] (Immortal Version)" on November 15, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://soundcloud.com/mjimmortal/wanna-be-startin-somethin|title=Wanna Be Startin' Somethin' by MJImmortal|date=2011-11-15|accessdate=2011-11-15|publisher=[[SoundCloud]]|work=Sony Music}}{{citation|url=http://www.michaeljackson.com/us/news/listen-another-track-immortal|title=Listen to Another Track from IMMORTAL|date=2011-11-15|accessdate=2011-11-15|publisher=The Official Michael Jackson Site|work=Sony Music}} *"[[I'll Be There (The Jackson 5 song)|I'll Be There]] (Immortal Version)" {{cite web|url=http://www.michaeljackson.com/us/news/listen-ill-be-there-immortal|title=I'll Be There by MJImmortal on SoundCloud|date=2011-11-16|accessdate=2011-11-16|publisher=[[SoundCloud]]|work=Sony Music}}{{citation|url=http://www.michaeljackson.com/us/news/listen-ill-be-there-immortal|title=Listen to "I'll Be There" from IMMORTAL|date=2011-11-16|accessdate=2011-11-16|publisher=The Official Michael Jackson Site|work=Sony Music}} and "[[Dancing Machine]]/[[Blame It on the Boogie]] (Immortal Version)" {{cite web|url=http://soundcloud.com/mjimmortal/dancing-machine-blame-it-on|title=Dancing Machine/Blame it on the Boogie by MJImmortal|date=2011-11-16|accessdate=2011-11-16|publisher=[[SoundCloud]]|work=Sony Music}} on November 16, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/465114/michael-jackson-song-premiere-dancing-machineblame-it-on-the|title=Michael Jackson Song Premiere: 'Dancing Machine/Blame It On The Boogie' - The Juice|publisher=Billboard.com|date=2011-11-16|accessdate=2011-11-16|author=Erika Ramirez, N.Y.}} *"[[This Place Hotel]]/[[Smooth Criminal]]/[[Dangerous (Michael Jackson song)|Dangerous]] (Immortal Version)"1{{cite web|url=http://soundcloud.com/mjimmortal/this-place-hotel-smooth|title=This Place Hotel/Smooth Criminal/Dangerous by MJImmortal on SoundCloud|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-17|publisher=[[SoundCloud]]|work=Sony Music}} and "[[Is It Scary]]/Threatened/[[Thriller (song)|Thriller]] (Immortal Version)"2{{cite web|url=http://soundcloud.com/mjimmortal/is-it-scary-threatened|title=Is It Scary/Threatened/Thriller by MJImmortal on SoundCloud|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-18|publisher=[[SoundCloud]]|work=Sony Music}} on November 17, 2011. '''NOTES:''' * 1 The three tracks are actually separated on the CD, but they were put on SoundCloud together like a whole mix. * 2 They are actually separated as two tracks "Is It Scary/Threatened (Immortal Version)" and "Thriller (Immortal Version)" on the CD, but they were put on SoundCloud together like a whole mix. The whole album was unveiled via [[NPR]] on November 18, 2011.{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2011/11/16/142418013/first-listen-michael-jackson-immortal|title=First Listen: Michael Jackson, 'Immortal' : NPR|publisher=NPR|date=2011-11-18|accessdate=2011-11-18|author=Ann Powers}} == Commercial performance == In the United States, an early estimate predicted ''Immortal'' would sell 50,000 copies in its first week.{{cite web|url=http://www.hitsdailydouble.com/news/newsPage.cgi?news08781|title=JINGLE BUBLE ALL THE WAY|date=2011-11-23|accessdate=2011-11-28|publisher=hitsdailydouble.com}} The album opened with 43,000 copies sold, debuting at No. 24 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. ''Immortal'''s opening week was larger than the acrobatic troupe's take on [[Elvis Presley]]'s ''[[Viva Elvis (album)|Viva Elvis]]'', which debuted and peaked at No. 48 in 2010 with 13,000 sold first week.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/record-labels/chart-moves-lady-gaga-s-marry-moves-up-michael-1005597362.story|title=Chart Moves: Lady Gaga's 'Marry' Moves Up, Michael Jackson Misses With 'Immortal', Divas Duke It Out|date=2011-12-01|accessdate=2011-12-03|publisher=Billboard.biz|author1=Gary Trust, N.Y. |author2=Keith Caulfield, L.A}} In Japan, 150,000 CD copies of this album had been sold during the first week of its release. ''Immortal'' was ranked number 174 on the list of the 200 best-selling albums of 2012 from the year-end charts of Billboard. It also was ranked number 35 on the top-selling 100 R&B albums of 2012. It is estimated that sales of ''Immortal'' as of 2013 are above 2 million units sold worldwide, with over 500,000 of those from the U.S. during 2012. It is currently the second-best selling Cirque show release, after [[Love (Beatles album)|Love]] from the Beatles inspired [[Love (Cirque du Soleil)|show of the same name.]] == Critical reception == The debut song "[[Immortal Megamix]]" received mixed reviews from [[music critics]]. Scott Shetler from ''Popcrash'' said the original songs were "left intact on this remix with only slight musical embellishments, such as a "Michael! Michael!" chant that appears during 'Billie Jean'", and despite other mixes as the "[[HIStory: Past, Present and Future, Book I|HIStory]] Megamix" that preceded his 1995 double-album were better, "with his (Michael Jackson's) legacy of musical gold, it would be nearly impossible to create a bad mix."{{cite web|url=http://popcrush.com/michael-jackson-immortal-megamix/|title=Michael Jackson, ‘Immortal Megamix’ – Song Review|author=Scott Shetler|publisher=popcrash.com|date=2011-11-03|accessdate=2011-11-07}} The album received mixed reviews. Ann Powers from ''[[NPR]]'' said, this soundtrack "adds another dimension to the Jackson omnibus," and it "crafts a new version of Jackson's life story through remixes of his biggest hits and a few obscurities, as well as his own stated favorite songs. " Kevin Antunes the musical designer for ''Immortal'' said, "There are jewels throughout this entire CD … put there so you can truly appreciate Michael's musicality," and, "It lifts you up, it challenges, it makes you feel. Being a super-fan myself, having the ability to work on this music is a true honor."{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/news/story/2011-11-17/michael-jackson-immortal-exclusive-track-cirque-du-soleil/51265870/1|title=Exclusive: Michael Jackson 'Immortal' remix – USATODAY.com|publisher=[[USAToday]]|date=2011-11-16|accessdate=2011-11-19|author=Carly Mallenbaum}} Randall Roberts from ''[[latimes.com]]'' gave this album two and a half stars out of four, "the soundtrack is beholden to the Cirque/Immortal story line and therefore sequenced not for the dance floor but for a Las Vegas-style production."{{cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/music_blog/2011/11/album-review-michael-jacksons-immortal.html|title=Album Review: Michael Jackson's "Immortal"|date=2011-11-21|accessdate=2011-11-22|author=Randall Roberts|publisher=[[latimes.com]]}} Chad Grischow from ''[[IGN]]'' said, "the collection at least does a fine job pulling from the various eras of his career", and "most of the songs are simply clipped into a shorter version of themselves, with the occasional sound effects to enhance the choreography left feeling odd without it."{{cite web|url=http://music.ign.com/articles/121/1213247p1.html|title=Michael Jackson: Immortal Review - MJ tribute too cluttered, chopped to offer good look at his career|author=Chad Grischow|date=2011-11-21|accessdate=2011-11-28|work=IGN}} Killian Fox of ''[[The Observer]]'' said, "not much here is new", "the album tries to justify its bulky existence", "but they add little to a catalogue of music that has already been superbly produced." {{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2011/nov/20/michael-jackson-immortal-review|title=Michael Jackson: Immortal – review|publisher=[[The Observer]] via [[guardian.co.uk]]|author=Killian Fox|date=2011-11-20|accessdate=2011-11-20}} Arwa Haider from ''[[metro.co.uk]]'' said, "the original songs are obviously fantastic", but "without the accompanying Cirque du Soleil acrobatics, these slightly spooky mixes don't add much to his canon. "{{cite web|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/music/reviews/882193-michael-jacksons-immortal-is-full-of-hits-but-a-bit-of-a-circus|title=Michael Jackson's Immortal is full of hits but a bit of a circus|date=2011-11-21|accessdate=2011-11-22|author=Arwa Haider|publisher=[[metro.co.uk]]}} Michael Langston Moore from ''[[examiner.com|African American Entertainment Examiner]]'' said the album "deemed to be a bit sacrilege".{{cite web|url=http://www.examiner.com/african-american-entertainment-in-national/michael-jackson-s-immortal-review-good-album-or-money-grabbing-scam-review |title=Michael Jackson's 'Immortal' review: Good album or money grabbing scheme? |author=Michael Langston Moore |date=2011-11-21 |work=African American Entertainment Examiner |publisher=[[Examiner.com]] |accessdate=2011-11-28 |deadurl=unfit |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/63Uzaq9Jd |archivedate=November 27, 2011 }} Gary Trust and Keith Caulfield from ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' pointed out that "consumers surely didn't seem that interested in the mash-up style album." Nekesa Mumbi Moody from ''[[The Associated Press]]'' said, "much of the album seems disjointed. Some songs are oddly chopped up, others are spliced together without much finesse, and there are a myriad of sound effects — bullets firing, glass shattering, the whistle of a train, basketballs bouncing — that just sound like noise," and "on stage, it probably all makes sense beautifully", "but without that visual picture, the listening experience is a disappointment."{{cite web|url=http://www.northjersey.com/arts_entertainment/134654878_Album_reviews__Michael_Jackson__Mary_J__Blige__Daughtry.html|title=Album reviews: Michael Jackson, Mary J. Blige, Daughtry|date=2011-11-28|accessdate=2011-12-04|author=Nekesa Mumbi Moody|work=[[The Associated Press]]|publisher=northjersey.com}} ==Track listing== MJJ Productions Inc, the record division of revision.comment: removed [[Category:Nativity of Jesus]]; added [[Category:Cultural depictions of the Nativity of Christ]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
'''Jane Henson's Nativity Story''' is a re-telling of the Christmas story with [[puppets]] from the co-creator of [[The Muppets]], [[Jane Henson]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Jane Henson's Nativity Story |url=https://janehensonnativitystory.wordpress.com/|access-date=3 May 2017}}</ref> It features live sacred music and a cast of puppets built by [[The Jim Henson Company]].
==Background== Collaborating with many artistic hands, [[Jane Henson]] developed vignettes for her “Nativity Story” at the 2009 [[Eugene O'Neill Theater Center|Eugene O’Neill]] Puppetry Theatre Conference and premiered the full show at the [[Orlando Puppet Festival]] in 2010, partnering with daughter [[Heather Henson]] and [[Ibex Puppetry]]. She subsequently sponsored performances in Florida schools and churches, like [[Winter Garden, Florida|Winter Garden]]’s Episcopal Church of the Messiah as well as St. Margaret Mary Catholic School and St. John Evangelical Lutheran Church, both in [[Winter Park, Florida|Winter Park]].
Henson died in 2013, but her “Nativity Story” has continued to tour. The show has been seen at [[St. James Cathedral (Orlando, Florida)|St. James Catholic Cathedral]] in [[Orlando, Florida]]; the [[Cathedral of Saint Andrew (Grand Rapids, Michigan)|Cathedral of St. Andrew]] in [[Grand Rapids, Michigan]]; and [[New York City]]’s [[St. Paul the Apostle Church (Manhattan)|St. Paul the Apostle Church]]. There, several of its puppetry scenes were filmed for 2013’s nationally broadcast [[CBS Television]] special “A New York Christmas to Remember,”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://saltandlighttv.org/christmastoremember/|title=A New York Christmas to Remember at Saint Paul the Apostle|publisher=saltandlighttv.org|accessdate=3 May 2017}}</ref> co-produced by [[Paulist Productions]] and hosted by [[Regis Philbin]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Mary Rezac|url=https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/the-nativity-show-from-the-creators-of-the-muppets-27465/|title=The nativity show from the creators of the Muppets|publisher=[[Catholic News Agency]]|date=15 September 2016|accessdate=3 May 2017}}</ref>
The premiere at Orlando’s St. James Cathedral featured actor-puppeteers [[Sarah Lockard]], Anthony Bolante, Jenny Weaver Barbieri, Curtiss Mitchell, [[Russell Nauman]], and [[Heather Henson]], with set and lighting by Vandy Wood, direction and dramaturgy by [[Sean Keohane]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Seth Kubersky|url=http://m.orlandoweekly.com/orlando/live-active-cultures/Content?oid=2246414|title=Live Active Cultures|publisher=[[Orlando Weekly]], [[Orlando, Florida]]|date=11 January 2012|accessdate=3 May 2017}}</ref> and music by the [[Olde Noyse Trio]]: John Rata, Cecie Catron, and Craig Thomas.<ref>{{cite web|title=''The Nativity Story'' Acknowledgments|url=https://janehensonnativitystory.wordpress.com/about/acknowledgments/|access-date=3 May 2017}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
==External links== * https://janehensonnativitystory.wordpress.com * {{Facebook|janehensonsnativitystagetour}}
[[Category:Puppetry]] [[Category:2010 works]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of the Nativity of Christ]]

{{Infobox film | name = Kaddu Beykat | image = | image_size = | caption = | director = [[Safi Faye]] | producer = | writer = Safi Faye{{cite web | title = Production Credits | publisher = [[Allmovie]] | url = http://www.allmovie.com/cg/avg.dll?p=avg&sql=1:145308~T3 | accessdate =2008-05-10 }} | narrator = | starring = Assane Faye
Maguette Gueye | music = | cinematography = | editing = [[André Davanture]] | distributor = | released = June 1976 (Berlin)
October 20, 1976 (France) | runtime = 90 minutes | country = Senegal | language = [[Serer language|Serer]], [[French language|French]] | budget = | gross = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Kaddu Beykat''''' (also known as ''Letter from My Village'' and ''Lettre paysanne'') is a [[1975 in film|1975]] [[Senegal]]ese film directed by [[Safi Faye]]. It was the first feature film made by a [[Sub-Sahara]]n African woman to be commercially distributed and brought international recognition for its director.Ukadike, p.30Spaas, p.185 Centred on a romance, it chronicles the daily lives of people in a rural Senegalese village. ==Plot== Ngor is a young man living in a Senegalese village who wishes to marry Columba. Ongoing [[drought]] in the village has affected its crop of [[peanut|groundnuts]] and as a result, Ngor cannot afford the [[bride price]] for Columba. He goes to Senegal's capital city, [[Dakar]], to try to earn more money and is exploited there. He returns to the villagers and shares his experiences of the city with the other men. The story, which shows the daily lives of the villagers, is told in the form of a letter to a friend from a villager, voiced by Faye.Russell, p. 59 ==Cast== * Assane Faye as Ngor * Maguette Gueye as Columba ==Background== ''Kaddu Beykat'' is set in Faye's family village, [[Fad'jal]] in southern Senegal.Thackway, p.151Schmidt, p.287 Financing for the film came from the [[France|French]] Ministry of Cooperation and it was made with a crew of three people.Foster, p.130 It is a mixture of [[Documentary film|documentary]] and fiction. For some parts of the film, Faye gathered villagers together, gave them a topic of conversation and proceeded to film them. She took advice from the villagers on what to film. As with her other work, Faye was careful to show African culture from the inside, rather than as an objective observer. The film is a critique of [[Colonialism|colonial]] farming practices and government policies which have encouraged single-crop farming of [[cash crop]]s for export, in some cases leading villages further into poverty. The film is dedicated to Faye's grandfather who features in the film, and who died 11 days after filming ended.Armes, p.79 ==Distribution and reception== ''Kaddu Beykat'' played at the 1976 [[Berlin International Film Festival]] where it won the [[FIPRESCI]] PrizePetrolle, p.177 and the [[OCIC]] Award. It also won the [[Georges Sadoul Prize]] and an award at the [[Panafrican Film and Television Festival of Ouagadougou]].{{cite web | title = Safi Faye | publisher = jiffynotes.com | year = 1998 | url = http://www.jiffynotes.com/a_study_guides/book_notes/ewb_05/ewb_05_02108.html | accessdate =2008-05-10 }} It was released in France on October 20, 1976. It was initially banned in Senegal.{{cite web | title = Africa Beyond | publisher = BBC | year = 2007 | url = http://www.bbc.co.uk/africabeyond/events/200703/ | accessdate =2008-05-10 }} Gwendolyn Audrey Foster| title = Women Film Directors: An International Bio-critical Dictionary| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=-kJHa7KqnQ4C| year = 1995| publisher = [[Greenwood Publishing Group]]| isbn = 978-0-313-28972-9| pages = 130–132 }} * {{cite book| last = Petrolle| first = Jean|author2=Virginia Wright Wexman| title = Women and Experimental Filmmaking| url = A.| title = Guide to African Cinema| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=PVhbVQPTSmcC| year = 1998| publisher = [[Greenwood Publishing Group]]| isbn = 978-0-313-29621-5| pages = 58–59 }} * {{cite book| last = Harrow| first = Kenneth W.| title = African Cinema: Postcolonial and Feminist Readings| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=kRR2fBv2NhUC| year = 1999| publisher = Africa World Press| isbn = 978-0-86543-697-8 }} * {{cite book| last = Spaas| first = Lieve| title = The Francophone Film: A Struggle for Identity| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=suDmAWP6VzoC| year = 2001| publisher = [[Manchester University Press]]| isbn = 978-0-7190-5861-5| pages = 185–188 }} * {{cite book| last = Thackway| first = Melissa| title = Africa Shoots Back: Alternative Perspectives in Sub-Saharan Francophone| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=__PzjrAIUtYC| year = 2003| publisher = James Currey Publishers| isbn = 978-0-85255-576-7| pages = 151–155 }} * {{cite book| last = Gabriel| title = Questioning African Cinema: Conversations with Filmmakers| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=_CMKoMS-0KkC| year = 2002| publisher = [[University of Minnesota Press]]| isbn = 978-0-8166-4004-1| pages = 29–40 }} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|0073223}} * {{AllRovi movie|145308|Kaddu Beykat}} {{authority control}} [[Category:1975 films]] [[Category:Films directed by Safi Faye]] [[Category:Senegalese black-and-white films]] [[Category:French-language films]] [[Category:Senegalese films]] [[Category:Serer-language films]] [[Category:Films by Serer directors]] [[Category:Films about the Serer people]]

{{Infobox company | name = Kerberos Productions | logo = Kerberos logo.png | type = [[Private company|Private]] | foundation = 2003 | location = [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]] | industry = [[Video game industry]] | revenue = | products = [[Sword of the Stars]]
[[Fort Zombie]] }} '''Kerberos Productions Inc.''' is a [[video game developer]] based in [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]]. The company was formed in 2003 by former employees of [[Rockstar Vancouver]]. The company takes its name and logo from [[Cerberus]], a large three-headed creature of Greek mythology (Κέρβερος, in Greek). The three heads of the hellhound represent the three disciplines of game development: art, programming, and design. The company has released six games: a [[4X game]] called ''[[Sword of the Stars]]'' (originally published by [[Lighthouse Interactive]], currently published by [[Paradox Interactive]]), its sequel ''[[Sword of the Stars 2]]'', a [[role-playing video game]] titled ''[[Fort Zombie]]'', a rogue-like game ''[[Sword of the Stars: The Pit]]'', a wargame called ''[[Ground Pounders]]'', and an action-strategy game called ''[[Kaiju-a-Gogo]]'' ==Games== * ''[[Sword of the Stars]]'' (2006) ** ''Sword of the Stars: Born of Blood'' (2007) (expansion) ** ''Sword of the Stars: A Murder of Crows'' (2008) (expansion) ** ''Sword of the Stars: Argos Naval Yard'' (2009) (expansion) * ''[[Fort Zombie]]'' (2009){{cite web|url=http://www.kerberos-productions.com/forum/viewforum.php?f=30 |title=Fort {{notability|book|date=November 2010}} {{Infobox book | name = Killing for Culture: An Illustrated History of Death Film from Mondo to Snuff | title_orig = | translator = | image = Killing for Culture.jpg| caption = | author = [[David Kerekes]], David Slater | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United Kingdom | language = English | series = [[Creation Cinema series]] | subject = [[film history]], [[popular culture|pop culture]], [[snuff film]] | genre = | publisher = [[Creation Books]] | pub_date = 1994 | english_pub_date = | media_type = paperback | pages = 284 | isbn = 1-871592-20-8 | congress= PN1995.9.D37 K47 1995 | oclc = 9781871592207 | preceded_by = | followed_by = [[Inside Teradome|Inside Teradome: An Illustrated History Of Freak Film]] }} '''''Killing for Culture: An Illustrated History of Death Film from Mondo to Snuff''''' (1994) is the first book in the [[Creation Cinema series]] and deals with death in film and media. ==Summary== ''Killing for Culture'' is a look into death on film including [[mondo films]] and [[snuff film]]s. It is divided into three sections, each with its own focus. ===Feature Film=== This section deals with [[snuff film]]s as seen in fictional movies.
It starts with a chapter on the infamous 1976 film ''[[Snuff (film)|Snuff]]''. Made by husband-and-wife team [[Michael Findlay]] and [[Roberta Findlay]] in 1971, it was left unreleased until 1976 when [[Allan Shackleton]] added a new ending, a scene depicting what was supposed to be the film crew for the preceding movie murdering one of the actresses. Shackleton marketed the film as authentic snuff and the film was a huge hit.{{cite book |last=Kerekes|first=David & Slater, David |title=Killing for Culture |year=1994|publisher=Creation Books|isbn=1-871592-20-8|pages=7–23.}}
The second chapter starts with an examination of [[Michael Powell (director)|Michael Powell's]] 1960 [[Peeping Tom (film)|''Peeping Tom'']]. The film follows the exploits of a photographer, who in his spare time kills women while filming them. Considered obscene and depraved, even with its lack of nudity or blood, the film ruined Powell's otherwise good career.
The next film looked at in this chapter is [[Joe D'Amato]]'s 1976 film ''[[Emanuelle in America]]'', part of the [[Black Emanuelle|Emanuelle]] series. Emanuelle, played by [[Laura Gemser]], is a photographer and journalist who investigates a snuff film and gets a little too close to the truth. ===Mondo Film=== This section of the book covered Mondo films, a series of exploitation "[[shockumentary|shockumentaries]]" that presented "actual" footage of deviant sexual activities or death. Many scenes in these films, while represented as real, were false. ===Death Film=== This section of the book discusses actual deaths caught on film, as presented through the media. One of the main subjects of the section was the broadcast suicide of Pennsylvania State Senator [[R. Budd Dwyer]]. ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071228194302/http://www.creationbooks.com/titles/1871592208.html Creation Books/''Killing For Culture'' (English)] [http://www.creationbooks.com/ Creation Books] Retrieved on 2008-2-28 *Gelder, Ken [https://web.archive.org/web/20060227103946/http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_go1931/is_200206/ai_n7044475 ''Killing for Culture'' review] (English) [http://findarticles.com/ FindaAticles.com]{{cbignore}} Retrieved on 2008-2-28 *Bracken, Mike [http://www.culturecartel.com/review.php?rid=10001940 ''Killing for Culture'' review] (English) [http://www.culturecartel.com/index.php Culture Cartel] Retrieved on 2008-2-28 {{DEFAULTSORT:Killing For Culture}} [[Category:Books about death]] [[Category:1994 books]] [[Category:History of film]] {{film-book-stub}}

A '''light plot''', '''lighting plot''' or just '''plot''' is a document like an architectural [[blueprint]] used specifically by theatrical [[lighting designers]] to illustrate and communicate the lighting design to the director, other designers and finally the [[Electrician (theater)|Master Electrician]] and electrics crew. The light plot specifies how each [[Stage lighting instrument|lighting instrument]] should be hung, focused, colored, and connected. Typically the light plot is supplemented by other paperwork such as the channel hookup or instrument schedule.
Up until the development of [[Computer-aided design|Computer Aided Drafting]] (CAD) programs, light plots were hand drawn or [[Technical drawing|drafted]] on special drafting paper. Though CAD programs and hand drafting require different techniques and methods, the information is presented and used in the same way. In order to be effective a light plot must: *Have some uniform [[Architect's scale|scale]] (typically 1/4"=1'-0" or 1/2"=1'-0"). *Define lighting instrument information such as focus, position, color and circuiting. *Have a title block and legend containing show information and information on how to identify the [[symbols]] on the plot. *Show the relationship of the lighting instruments to the architecture of the space, scenic elements, and the lighting positions.<ref>Moody, James L.: "Concert Lighting", page 29-51. Focal Press, 1998</ref>
==Parts of a Plot== ===Plan View=== The plan view is the primary view of the light plot and contains the most information on the lighting instruments and their locations. As per the design definition, the [[plan view]] illustrates how the venue space would appear to someone above it. It contains the relevant [[architectural]] information of the venue space including locations of walls, the floor level, the location of seats and balconies, and occasionally [[sight lines]], as well as the location of each lighting instrument and other relevant hardware, like modular [[dimmer]] boxes. The plan must also include information on the [[electrical|electrical systems]] of the theater--the location of [[Electrical outlet|outlet]]s connected to the theater's [[dimmers]] and the available lighting positions--rails, booms, side arms, and [[Catwalk (theater)|catwalks]]. The plan view may also contain scenic information, such as a drawing of the [[Set construction|set]]. <ref> Lounsbury, Warren C., Norman C. Boulanger: "Theater Backstage from A to Z", page 147. University of Washington Press, 1999.</ref>
===Section and Elevation View=== The supplementary (and generally optional) section (side) and elevation (front) views contain much of the same information as the plan view. The section is a cutaway view of the house and stage from either the left or the right. The section line is typically the venue's [[Parts of a theater|center line]]. The elevation is a plot oriented as if viewing the stage from the audience. These supplementary views serve primarily to further illustrate relevant architectural and scenic features, including sight lines. Most commonly the section and elevation plots feature limited electrical information and are used mainly as a reference for the lighting designer or electrician to identify the purpose of each lighting fixture, especially as to how it interacts with any relevant scenic elements. The elevation and section views might also be provided to the electrics crew as a secondary reference for the positions of lighting instruments.<ref> Lounsbury, Warren C., Norman C. Boulanger: "Theater Backstage from A to Z", page 176 & 61. University of Washington Press, 1999.</ref>
===Lighting Instruments=== The instrument layer contains all the information relating to the lighting instruments. This includes: *The specific location of each lighting instrument represented by a unique symbol. *Information on each instrument including dimmer/channel number, lens size, [[color gel]], and any special augmentations (including color wheels and [[Gobo (lighting)|gobos]]). *Special notes for the electrics crew, including specific information on how instruments are hung and fastened. *Auxiliary Lighting units such as [[followspot]]s or a "practicals" (lights which are part of the set, like house lamps, which are used visibly in the performance).
In the past when plots were completely hand drafted, a lighting designer would sometimes plot the lighting instruments on a transparent overlay which could be placed over the plan, section and/or elevation views, therefore allowing the "blank" views (containing only architectural information) to be re-used for other lighting configurations. The advent of CAD-based lighting design has made this practice obsolete, though occasionally useful.
The information contained in the lighting instruments section should follow consistent, easy to understand rules which are explained in the key, expediting the electric crew's job of hanging and focusing the fixtures. <ref>Moody, James L.: "Concert Lighting", page 48-49. Focal Press, 1998</ref>
===Title Block=== The title block contains several pieces of key information on the production including the show title, date, and venue name, as well as the names of the performance's lighting designer and director. The title block also contains the legend, which identifies all of the drafting symbols used in the plot, as well as any special notes
==Other important lighting paperwork== In addition to the light plot there are a number of other important pieces of paperwork (i.e. Dimmer hookup, [[Instrument Schedule]], and Magic Sheet) in a complete lighting design. As each part of the lighting design is relevant only to a specific group of technicians, the entire design is generally provided only to the director and master electrician.
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Stage lighting]] [[Category:Stagecraft]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2012}} {{Use British English|date=May 2012}} {{multiple issues| {{refimprove|date=March 2016}} {{lead too short|date=March 2016}} }} {{Infobox person | name = Michael White | image = | caption = | imagesize = | birth_name = Michael Simon White | birth_date = {{Birth date|1936|1|16|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Glasgow]], Scotland | death_date = {{Death date and age|2016|3|7|1936|1|16|df=yes}} | death_place = [[Ojai, California]], U.S. | nationality = Scottish | education = [[Lyceum Alpinum Zuoz]], Switzerland | alma_mater = [[University of Paris]] | occupation = Theatre producer, film producer | years_active = 1961–2013 | notable_works = {{ubl|[[Oh! Calcutta!]], 1970 [[West End theatre|West End]] | [[Sleuth (play)|Sleuth]], 1971 [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] | [[Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat]], 1973 West End | [[The Rocky Horror Show]], 1973 West End | [[Monty Python and the Holy Grail]], 1974 (film) | [[The Rocky Horror Picture Show]], 1975 (film) | [[A Chorus Line]], 1976 West End | [[Jabberwocky (film)|Jabberwocky]], 1977 (film) | [[Annie (musical)|Annie]], 1978 West End | [[My Dinner With Andre]], 1981 (film) | [[The Comic Strip Presents]]..., 1982 (TV) | [[She Loves Me]], 1994 West End [[revival (theatre)|revival]]}} | awards = {{ubl|'''[[Tony Award for Best Play]]''' | 1971: ''[[Sleuth (play)|Sleuth]]'' | [[Laurence Olivier Award for Best Musical Revival]]''' | 1994: ''[[She Loves Me]]'' | '''[[Critics' Circle Theatre Award]] for Best Musical''' | 1994: ''She Loves Me'' | '''[[Evening Standard Award]] for Best Musical''' | 1973: ''[[The Rocky Horror Show]]'' | 1976: ''A Chorus Line'' | 1978: ''[[Annie (musical)|Annie]]'' | '''[[Evening Standard British Film Awards|Evening Standard British Film Award]] for Best Film''' | 1982: ''[[Moonlighting (film)|Moonlighting]]'' | 1983: ''[[The Ploughman's Lunch]]'' | '''[[Boston Society of Film Critics]] Best American Film''' | 1982: ''[[My Dinner With Andre]]''}}}}
'''Michael Simon White''' (16 January 1936 – 7 March 2016) was a British theatrical [[impresario]] and [[film producer]]. White produced 101 stage productions and 27 films over 50 years.
==Early life== Michael White was born in Glasgow, Scotland, the son of Doris (Cohen), who became successful in property development and management, and Victor White, who ran a glove making business.<ref>http://www.filmreference.com/film/62/Michael-White.html</ref> His mother was [[Eastern Europe]]an [[Jewish]] and his father was born in Dublin, Ireland.<ref name="Coveney">{{cite news|last=Coveney|first=Michael|url=https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2016/mar/09/michael-white-producer-obituary|title=Michael White obituary|work=The Guardian|date=9 March 2016|accessdate=9 March 2016}}</ref> As White suffered from [[asthma]] as a boy, his parents decided he would be educated as a boarder at the [[Lyceum Alpinum Zuoz]] in [[Switzerland]] from age 7, where he was the only boy who did not speak the [[French language]]. He then graduated from the [[University of Paris|Sorbonne]] in [[Paris]].<ref name=Telg3561719/>
==Career== After working as a [[Wall Street]] runner in [[New York City]] in the 1950s, White took an interest in theatre, spending five years as assistant to [[Peter Daubeny|Sir Peter Daubeny]] for his World Theatre seasons in [[London]].
White produced his first [[West End theatre|West End]] play, the London premiere of [[Jack Gelber]]'s ''[[The Connection (play)|The Connection]]'' in 1961.<ref name="Coveney"/><ref>{{cite book |title=The Other Careers: earning a living in the arts and media |last=Bygrave |first=Mike |author2=Joan Goodman|author3=John Fordham |page=159 |year=1973 |publisher=Wildwood House |isbn=978-0-7045-0052-5 }}</ref> Known for bringing the risqué to the stage his productions included ''[[Sleuth (play)|Sleuth]]'',<ref>{{cite book |title=Theatre |authorlink=Sheridan Morley |last=Morley |first=Sheridan |page=30 |year=1974 |publisher=[[Hutchinson (publisher)|Hutchinson]] |isbn=978-0-09-122290-1 }}</ref> ''[[Oh! Calcutta!]]'',<ref>{{cite news |author=Alan Travis|title=How two dames saved Oh! Calcutta! |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2000/dec/23/alantravis |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=23 December 2000 |accessdate=28 February 2011 }}</ref> ''[[Two Gentlemen of Verona (musical)|Two Gentlemen of Verona]]'' and the original Theatre Upstairs production of ''[[The Rocky Horror Show]]''.
Concurrently, White produced films, including the film version of ''[[The Rocky Horror Picture Show]]'' and ''[[Monty Python and the Holy Grail]]'' (both 1975). Later, he was responsible for ''[[The Comic Strip Presents]]...'' with [[Peter Richardson (actor)|Peter Richardson]], which began on the opening night of [[Channel 4]] in 1982.<ref name="Coveney"/>
However, losses on films mounted, and he was declared [[bankrupt]] in 2005 after suffering a [[heart attack]] at the [[Mondrian Hotel]] in [[Los Angeles]].<ref name=Telg3561719/>
==Media== White's autobiography, ''Empty Seats'', was published in 1985.<ref>{{cite book |title=Empty Seats |last=White |first=Michael |publisher=H.Hamilton |edition=1st |year=1984 |isbn=978-0-241-11348-6}}</ref>
White's life story was the subject of the 2013 documentary film ''[[The Last Impresario]]'', directed by [[Gracie Otto]]. The film made its world premiere at the [[BFI London Film Festival]] in October 2013,<ref>Oliver Pfeiffer, [http://www.sbs.com.au/movies/article/2013/09/10/gracie-ottos-last-impresario-premiere-london-film-festival "Gracie Otto's The Last Impresario to premiere at London Film Festival"], SBS.com.au, 10 September 2013.</ref><ref> Cara Nash, [http://filmink.com.au/news/lsquothe-last-impresariorsquo-to-premiere-at-bfi-london-film-festival/ "'The Last Impresario' to premiere at BFI London Film Festival"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505003758/http://filmink.com.au/news/lsquothe-last-impresariorsquo-to-premiere-at-bfi-london-film-festival/ |date=5 May 2014 }}, FilmInk.com.au, 5 September 2013.</ref> where it was positively received by critics.<ref>Charles Gant, [https://variety.com/2013/film/reviews/london-film-review-the-last-impresario-1200776146/ "London Film Review: 'The Last Impresario'"], ''Variety Magazine'', 29 October 2013.</ref><ref>Stephen Dalton, [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/last-impresario-london-review-648136 "The Last Impresario: London Review"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', 13 October 2013.</ref><ref>[http://wizardradio.co.uk/news/?p=47 "Review: The Last Impresario"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505003021/http://wizardradio.co.uk/news/?p=47 |date=5 May 2014 }}, WizardRadio.co.uk, 14 October 2013.</ref>
==Personal life== White was married twice. With his first wife, the 1960s model and designer [[Sarah Hillsdon]] (1965-1972), he had three children. With his second wife, Louise, an heiress 26 years his junior, he had a son. His ex-girlfriends included film director [[Lyndall Hobbs]].<ref name=Telg3561719>{{cite news|last1=Kennaway|first1=Guy|title=Michael White's celebrity photo album|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/3561719/Michael-Whites-celebrity-photo-album.html|accessdate=11 August 2014|work=Daily Telegraph|date=5 October 2008}}</ref>
White died on 7 March 2016 of [[heart failure]], aged 80.<ref name="death">{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-people-michaelwhite-idUSKCN0WB067|title=Veteran British producer Michael White dies age 80|publisher=Reuters.com|accessdate=March 8, 2016}}</ref>
==Selected theatrical productions== This list is incomplete, currently listing only White's most notable theatre works:
===Musicals=== As producer: * ''[[Oh! Calcutta!]]'' (1970, [[West End theatre|West End]]) * ''[[Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat]]'' (1973, West End) * ''[[The Rocky Horror Show]]'' (1973, West End) * ''[[Two Gentlemen of Verona (musical)|Two Gentlemen of Verona]]'' (1973, West End) * ''[[A Chorus Line]]'' (1976, West End) * ''[[Annie (musical)|Annie]]'' (1978, West End) * ''[[She Loves Me]]'' (1994, West End [[revival (theatre)|revival]])
===Plays=== As producer: * ''[[Sleuth (play)|Sleuth]]'' (1971, [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]]) * ''[[City Sugar]]'' (1978)
==Filmography== As producer or executive producer: * ''[[Monty Python and the Holy Grail]]'' (1974) * ''[[The Rocky Horror Picture Show]]'' (1975) * ''[[Jabberwocky (film)|Jabberwocky]]'' (1977) * ''[[The Hound of the Baskervilles (1978 film)|The Hound of the Baskervilles]]'' (1978) * ''Going With The Wind'' (1981) * ''[[My Dinner With Andre]]'' (1981) * ''[[Polyester (film)|Polyester]]'' (1981) * ''[[Shock Treatment]]'' (1981) * ''[[Countryman (film)|Countryman]]'' (1982) * ''[[Moonlighting (film)|Moonlighting]]'' (1982) * ''[[Urgh! A Music War]]'' (1982) * ''[[The Comic Strip Presents]]...'' (1982) * ''[[Dead on Time (1983 film)|Dead on Time]]'' (1983) * ''[[Heat and Dust (film)|Heat and Dust]]'' (1983) * ''[[The Ploughman's Lunch]]'' (1983) * ''[[Strangers Kiss]]'' (1983) * ''[[The Supergrass]]'' (1985) * ''[[High Season (film)|High Season]]'' (1987) * ''[[Eat the Rich (film)|Eat the Rich]]'' (1987) * ''[[White Mischief (film)|White Mischief]]'' (1987) * ''[[The Deceivers (film)|The Deceivers]]'' (1988) * ''[[Nuns on the Run]]'' (1989) * ''[[The Pope Must Die]]'' (1991) * ''Robert's Movie'' (1994) * ''[[Widows' Peak]]'' (1994) * ''[[Enigma (2001 film)|Enigma]]'' (2001) Appearing as himself: * ''[[The Last Impresario]]'' (2013)
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * {{IMDb name|0925214|Michael White}} * [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/michael-white-much-loved-theatre-and-film-producer-whose-hits-included-oh-calcutta-and-the-rocky-a6924356.html Obituary] in [[The Independent]] by [[Marcus Williamson]]

[[File:Princess Kay-20100830-crop.JPG|thumbnail|150px|Princess Kay of the Milky Way (Katie Miron, 2010)]] '''Milk Queen''' (often called ''Dairy Princess'' or ''Milk Princess'') is the title awarded to the winner of regularly-organized competitions by [[Dairy]] Associations in many countries.
== Idea == The Milk Queen, from a [[marketing]] point of view, is a [[brand]] or product [[testimonial]]. Similar to Apple-, Asparagus-, Beer-, Corn-, Must-, Potato- or Wine Queens<ref>[https://www.daad.de/blog/tandem-reporter/royal-germany-meet-the-highnesses/ Royal Germany – meet the Highnesses], 2011-01-22, ''German Academic Exchange Service - DAAD'' (Retrieved 2013-07-15)</ref> she promotes a certain [[food group]]. Normally elected for a region, she represents dairy products from this region. The purpose of the Milk Queen is to inform the public of the many benefits of consuming dairy products on a daily basis. Promotion activities may include appearances at [[trade show]]s or consumer events, primary schools and press conferences.
As a condition, it is expected that Milk Queen candidates will be charming with strong self-esteem, and a basic knowledge about dairy production. Remuneration or financial award is not usually granted to the Queen, but expenses for business traveling and clothing are reimbursed. Some organizers give out prizes to winners, like travels.
== United States == Norma Garrett of [[Harvard]] was elected the ''1st Harvard Milk Day Queen'' in 1945.<ref>''[http://www.milkdays.com/history.asp The History of Milk Days]'', ''milkdays.com'' (Retrieved 2013-07-15)</ref> In most other [[U.S. state]]s elected representatives are called ''Dairy Princess''. They normally are elected from all related County Dairy Princesses, as e.g. the 1954 established [[Princess Kay of the Milky Way]] is the winner of the statewide ''Minnesota Dairy Princess Program'' with around 100 participants.<ref>Carla Baranauckas, ''[https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40D16FD345A0C748EDDA10894DD404482 Minnesota State Fair Journal; A Dairy Queen, Oops, Princess, in All Her Buttery Glory]'', 2005-08-27, [[The New York Times]] (Retrieved 2013-06-25)</ref> Other State Dairy Princesses are the ''Indiana Dairy Princess'',<ref>[http://www.winnersdrinkmilk.com/dairy-fans_promotions-and-events_dairy-princess.html Report] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131118215029/http://www.winnersdrinkmilk.com/dairy-fans_promotions-and-events_dairy-princess.html |date=2013-11-18 }}, ''American Dairy Association'' (Retrieved 2013-06-25)</ref> the ''Maryland Dairy Princess'',<ref>''[http://www.holsteinworld.com/story.php?id=2069 Wiles named Maryland Dairy Princess] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130319193452/http://holsteinworld.com/story.php?id=2069 |date=2013-03-19 }}'', ''Holsteinworld.com'' (Retrieved 2013-06-25)</ref> the ''New York Dairy Princess'',<ref>''[http://blog.syracuse.com/voices/2009/02/new_york_dairy_princess_is_cro.html New York Dairy Princess is crowned in Salina]'' 2009-02-18, ''Syracuse.com'', ''The Post - Standard'' (Retrieved 2013-06-25)</ref> the ''North Dakota Dairy Princess'',<ref>''[http://www.wdexpo.org/2008/07/24/bohnenkamp-named-nd-dairy-princess/ Bohnenkamp Named N.D. Dairy Princess]'' vom 24. Juli 2008 bei ''wdexpo.org'' (Retrieved 2013-06-25)</ref> the ''Pennsylvania State Dairy Princess,''<ref>''[http://www.wdexpo.org/2008/09/22/kapanick-crowned-2008-pa-state-dairy-princess/ Kapanick Crowned 2008 Pa. State Dairy Princess]'', September 2008, ''wdexpo.org'' (Retrieved 2013-06-25)</ref> the ''Nebraska State Dairy Princess''<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.midwestdairy.com/schools-and-communities/dairy-princess/nebraska-dairy-princess/|title=Nebraska Dairy Princess - Midwest Dairy Association|work=Midwest Dairy Association|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en-US}}</ref> (reigning Princess [[Marta Pulfer]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.midwestdairy.com/new-nebraska-dairy-princess-crowned-in-columbus/|title=New Nebraska Dairy Princess Crowned in Columbus - Midwest Dairy Association|date=2017-02-21|work=Midwest Dairy Association|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en-US}}</ref>), or the ''Virginia Dairy Princess''. [[File:Krolowa Mleka 2014 IMG 5479.JPG|thumb|The Polish Milk Queen for 2014, Katarzyna Gajownik and Waldemar Broś, Chairman of the Polish Federation of Dairy Cooperatives (KZSM ZR)]]
* [[Wisconsin's Dairy Queen and Alice in Dairyland]]
== Europe == In Germany and Austria several Milk Queens (''Milchkönigin'') are elected by [[States of Germany|state]] dairy associations. Since 1985 the [[Bavaria]]n Dairy Industry (''Landesvereinigung der Bayerischen Milchwirtschaft'') elects bi-yearly a Queen and a Princess. State Associations in [[Brandenburg]],<ref>[http://www.saskia-storm.brandenburghalle.com/ Website] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130710100941/http://www.saskia-storm.brandenburghalle.com/ |date=2013-07-10 }}, ''Brandenburger Agrarministerium'', in German (Retrieved 2013-07-16)</ref> [[Hesse]], [[Rhineland-Palatinate]],<ref>[http://www.milag.net/milchkoenigin.htm Website], ''Milchwirtschaftliche Arbeitsgemeinschaft Rheinland-Pfalz e.V.'', in German (Retrieved 2013-07-16)</ref> [[Saxony]]<ref>''Neue Landwirtschaft'', Deutscher Landwirtschaftsverlag, 18th edition, Berlin-Pankow 2007, p 35, in German</ref> and [[Thuringia]]<ref>[http://www.milch-thueringen.de/scripts/lvtm.exe?INFO?Milchkoenigin Website]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, ''Landesvereinigung Thüringer Milch e.V.'', in German (Retrieved 2013-07-16)</ref> elect Milk Queens too.
[[Lower Austria]]'s Katrin I. is the newest Milk Queen in German-speaking countries. She was elected in 2012.<ref>[http://www.fao.org/fileadmin/templates/est/COMM_MARKETS_MONITORING/Dairy/Documents/WORLD_MILK_DAY_2012.pdf The 12th World Milk Day, 1 June 2012] (Retrieved 2013-07-16)</ref> In [[Poland]] in 2013 the election of a Polish Milk Queen (''Polska Królowa Mleka'') was initiated for the first time.<ref>[http://www.krolowamleka.pl/idea Website], ''Królowa Mleka'', in Polish (Retrieved 2013-07-15)</ref>
== South America == In [[Argentina]] at several events a Queen of Milk (''La Reina de la Leche'') gets elected. Different than in other countries, this election is a [[beauty contest]] only.
